tools.python.check_list_depth¶

tools.python.check_list_depth(input_list, depth_count=1, max_depth=0, n_args=0)¶

Function to calculate the depth of nested loops

TODO: Finish this damn code

Parameters

  • input_list (list) – Input argument to check

  • depth_count (int, optional) – Depth of nested loops thus far

  • max_depth (int, optional) – Maximum expected depth of list, default=0 (not checked)

  • n_args (int, optional) – Required length of ‘base’ list, default=0 (not checked)

Returns

depth_count – Depth of nested loops

Return type

int

Notes

A list of form [a1, a2, a3, …] has depth 1. A list of form [[a1, a2, a3, …], [b1, b2, b3, …], …] has depth 2. And so forth…

If n_args is set to an integer greater than 0, it will check that the lowest level of lists (for all entries) will be of the required length

if depth=1 as above, len([a1, a2, a3, …]) == n_args if depth=2 as above, len([a1, a2, a3, …]) == n_args && len([b1, b2, b3, …]) == n_args
